node.title: New Covid data show New York returning to pre-Omicron surge levels.
node.description: Gov. Kathy Hochul reported the lowest number of hospitalizations since mid-December.

node.title: Vehicle crashes through overbridge, dropping to motorway below
node.description: There are delays on State Highway 1's southbound lanes in Auckland this morning after a vehicle crashed through the overbridge last night, falling onto the motorway below.

node.title: Palmerston North council seeks land status change to allow housing development
node.description: Palmerston North officials are asking Parliament to help turn an overgrown former city bowling green into housing.

node.title: Delay in filling key role holding up Milford Sound project
node.description: A crucial tourism project is facing delays as it struggles to find a project leader.

node.title: Abuse survivor wants 'genuine apology' from St John of God
node.description: A survivor of abuse at a home for at-risk youth in Christchurch in the 1990s says he felt too "ashamed and embarrassed" to speak out about it at the time.

node.title: SH3 to close for roadworks at Mt Messenger
node.description: State Highway 3 just north of Mt Messenger in Taranaki will be closed for four hours a day in the coming week.

node.title: Canadian judge orders end to Covid-19 protest blockade at US border bridge
node.description: A Canadian judge has ordered protesters at the Ambassador Bridge to end a five-day-old blockade that has disrupted the flow of goods.

node.title: Big increase in dirty water complaints in Napier
node.description: Dirty water complaints in Napier have risen rapidly in recent months.

node.title: Forensic cleaner mistaken for company which posted graphic social media posts
node.description: A Wellington forensic cleaner has had a flood of angry callers and emailers this week, but they have got the wrong guy.

node.title: Covid outbreak of 13 at Auckland City Hospital
node.description: Six staff members and seven patients at Auckland City Hospital have tested positive for Covid-19.

node.title: Recovery of treasure from "holy grail" of shipwrecks moving forward
node.description: The wreck of the San Jose was found off Columbia's coast, but Spain and native Bolivians have also staked claims to its fabled riches.

node.title: Zoology and Org Charts
node.description: Our critic recommends old and new books.

node.title: Russian warship chases off U.S. submarine, Moscow says
node.description: The crew of the Russian ship "used appropriate means" and the U.S. submarine left at full speed, the Russian defense ministry said.

node.title: Bates ton sets up victory
node.description: The White Ferns' preparations for the ICC Cricket World Cup began in style with a dominant win over India in the first one day international.

node.title: After Nearly 58 Years, Pennsylvania Police Solve Killing of 9-Year-Old Girl
node.description: On Sundays and holidays, the victim’s mother ended a prayer with a plea: “Please help the Pennsylvania State Police find the man that hurt my daughter.”

node.title: Fourteen years on from Sorry Day, healing continues amid fears of 'another Stolen Generation'
node.description: Today marks the 14th anniversary of National Sorry Day and the moment that Stolen Generation survivor James Michael "Widdy" Welsh says his pain was acknowledged, but data on the number of Indigenous children entering out-of-home care sparks fears of "another Stolen generation".

node.title: French police fire tear gas as convoy protesting against COVID restrictions reaches central Paris
node.description: A convoy of demonstrators protesting against COVID-19 restrictions has reached central Paris, snarling traffic around the Arc de Triomphe and on the Champs-Élysées, where police have responded with tear gas.

node.title: Liberal candidate will not concede Bega by-election despite Premier congratulating her opponent
node.description: Fiona Kotvojs says she will not concede defeat in the Bega by-election despite a double-digit swing against her and Premier Dominic Perrottet congratulating her Labor opponent.

node.title: Biden warns Putin of "swift and severe costs" if Russia invades Ukraine
node.description: The warning comes as U.S. officials say a Russian invasion could begin "at any time​."

node.title: Ukraine tensions: Russia invasion could begin any day, US warns
node.description: Countries including the UK, the USA, the Netherlands, Latvia, Japan and South Korea have urged their nationals to leave Ukraine.

node.title: Covid cases delay Super Rugby Pacific opener
node.description: Seven members of the Moana Pasifika Super Rugby Pacific squad have tested positive for Covid-19 in Queenstown, postponing the opening game of the new competition.

node.title: Loud music and vaccination ads used to try and deter protesters
node.description: The protest against the government's Covid-19 restrictions has persisted at Parliament today, despite a heavy downpour of rain.

node.title: Photo captures Mount Etna eruption creating rare volcanic lightning
node.description: An expert said that such volcanic storms are rare but can happen in particularly violent eruptions.

node.title: The story of four Black NFL players who changed the face of the game
node.description: Despite being an integrated league at its founding, there were no Black players in the NFL from 1933-1945.

node.title: 'I really took a lot of things for granted': How an accident made Jacob realise the problem with festivals
node.description: In 2019, Jacob broke his neck by doing a front flip. The incident crushed his spinal cord and he spent the next nine months in hospital. It wasn't long after leaving the hospital that Jacob started looking into attending gigs again, only to realise just how difficult accessing the venues were.

node.title: Get set for Super Bowl LVI and everything else you need to know
node.description: The teams, the stars, the start times, how to watch and who's on at half-time — check out our lowdown of everything you need to know about Super Bowl LVI as the Los Angeles Rams take on the Cincinnati Bengals in the NFL's season finale.

node.title: Is this the COVID 'crystal ball' WA is looking for? How South Australia could inform the west's reopening
node.description: As Western Australians wonder how the state's eventual border reopening might unfold, pundits often draw on the South Australian experience. But how comparable are the states and what bearing did SA have on Premier Mark McGowan's call to indefinitely delay the border opening?

node.title: This adaptation of a Murakami story is the first Japanese film nominated for a best picture Oscar
node.description: This introspective and lyrical melodrama from Japanese director Ryûsuke Hamaguchi centres on a grief-stricken middle-aged theatre director who, reeling from his marriage breakdown, forms an unusual friendship with his aloof young tomboy driver.

node.title: It's been six months since Kabul fell to the Taliban. For those who made it to Australia, it's a bittersweet anniversary
node.description: Ali Rahmani still cannot believe his family made it out of Afghanistan when they were forced to flee the Taliban. Six months later, they could not be more grateful to call Perth home, but memories of their homeland will always be tinged with trauma.

node.title: As India marks 75 years since independence, how is Australia's 'dear friend' Narendra Modi reshaping the country?
node.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is transforming India to improve the lives of the "common people" and especially the poor, but critics say he is steering the nation down an illiberal path, stoking religious tensions and undermining democratic institutions.
